instruction: What metric was chosen to evaluate the performance of the machine learning models in the integrated AI system for smart detection of beer faults, and how far can this metric go?

instruction: How were the machine learning models developed and what inputs were used in the proposed integrated AI system for smart detection of beer faults?
Output:
The machine learning models in the proposed integrated AI system for smart detection of beer faults were developed using different inputs. Model 1 (M1) and Model 2 (M2) were developed using the near-infrared spectroscopy (NIR) absorbance values and the electronic nose (e-nose) sensor readings as inputs, respectively. M1 used 100 inputs from the NIR absorbance values ranging from 1596-2396 nm, while M2 used nine sensor readings from the e-nose.

Model 3 (M3) and Model 4 (M4) were based on the NIR absorbance values, and Model 5 (M5) and Model 6 (M6) were based on the e-nose sensor readings as inputs. All four models (M3, M4, M5, and M6) used the 19 aroma profiles as targets.

The inputs for the machine learning models were the measurements obtained from the NIR absorbance values and the e-nose sensor readings, while the targets were the 19 aroma profiles representing different beer faults and the control aroma.

instruction: Can the proposed integrated AI system for smart detection of beer faults using near-infrared spectroscopy (NIR) and a newly developed electronic nose (e-nose) be considered superior to traditional methods in ensuring a high-quality product and consumer acceptability in the brewing process?
